AboutPage.content: Yashil Energiya - powering the green economy

event.description: 16.02.2023  "Green Energy" LLC was established based on Presidential Decree No. 57 of 2023 on accelerating the introduction of renewable energy sources and energy-saving technologies.
By the end of 2023, the capacity of the PV plants installed and operated by "Yashil Energiya" LLC exceeded 20,000 kW.
In order to contribute to the "green" economy, "Green Energy" LLC has established departments of mini and micro hydropower plants and electric vehicle charging stations.
By the end of 2024, the capacity of PV stations owned by "Green Energy" LLC exceeded 48,000 kW.

AboutPage.paragraph1: "Green Energy" LLC is a company that specializes in the development and implementation of renewable energy solutions in the Republic of Uzbekistan. We were founded on February 16, 2023, under the Decree of the President of the Republic, No-57.
AboutPage.paragraph2: Ensuring sustainable development and protecting the environment in order to contribute to the energy independence of the country by widely introducing renewable energy sources. Our main goal is to ensure the provision of quality electricity to all social and governmental facilities.

project1.title: Establish solar photovoltaic power plants to provide quality electricity for the buildings of social facilities, government agencies, and other organizations.

project2.title: Simultaneously charging multiple electric vehicles using high-quality electricity from innovative devices.

project3.title: The construction and efficient use of micro hydro power plants in Uzbekistan.

achievement1.description: Service centers in all regions of the Republic

achievement2.description: 50 MW photovoltaic power plants are currently in operation

achievement3.description: In 1 200 social facilities, solar photovoltaic power plants have been installed

achievement4.description: The average annual electricity generated is 50,000 MW per year.

SolarPanelsPage.title: PV Power Plants
SolarPanelsPage.list: Today, PV Power Plants (PVPPs) are becoming increasingly important energy sources in many countries around the globe. They are:
SolarPanelsPage.listItem1: Does not harm the environment (clean energy source).
SolarPanelsPage.listItem2: Reduces dependence on fossil fuels such as oil and gas.
SolarPanelsPage.listItem3: Help reduce the cost of electricity.

content.description1: Many developed countries (USA, China, Germany) make extensive use of solar energy. For instance, China has the world's largest PVPP.
content.description2: In Uzbekistan, solar energy is also paid attention to, as the number of sunny days per year exceeds 300. This presents a great opportunity for the development of solar power plants, which will help reduce electricity costs and improve energy efficiency in the future.

SolarPanelsPage.systemTitle: PVPP are divided into 3 different main types:

system1.title: On-grid (grid-tied)
system1.description: The main system is connected to the electrical grid, which first uses the electricity generated by PVPP. If there are interruptions to the mains, the system will also stop working.

system2.title: Off-grid (standalone)
system2.description: Not connected to the mains and operates independently, storing energy in batteries. This makes it suitable for areas where there is no plug socket available, but the cost of the batteries will be higher.

system3.title: Hybrid
system3.description: There is a combination of on-grid and off-grid systems, which makes it the most flexible but also relatively expensive system, as it requires a power supply through the grid or operation through batteries.

SolarPanelsPage.mapTitle: Information about the current PVPP status of "Green Energy" LLC
SolarPanelsPage.chartDescription: "Green Energy" LLC has been investing in social and governmental facilities located in the Republic of Uzbekistan since 2023. The diagram shows changes in the total number of PV plants that are relevant to company.

MicroGesPage.title: Hydroelectric power plants
MicroGesPage.subTitle: From nature - towards clean energy!
MicroGesPage.content: "Green Energy" LLC is constantly contributing to the introduction of stable and environmental sources in Uzbekistan. The Department of micro hydropower is one of the important directions in this way.
MicroGesPage.listDescription: MHP plants are small facilities with a capacity ranging from 5 kW to 500 kW that generate electricity using the flow of water. These plants have several advantages:
MicroGesPage.listItem2: Environmental safety – no harm to the environmen
MicroGesPage.listItem3: Addressing energy shortages in rural areas
MicroGesPage.listItem4: Low-cost maintenance and a long-life service.
MicroGesPage.servicesItem1: Design of hydraulic engineering and energy systems
MicroGesPage.servicesItem2: The construction of a MHP under the "turnkey" project
MicroGesPage.schemaTitle: "Yashil Energiya" LLC, in collaboration with foreign and local investors, is planning to construct and commission a MHP as a "turnkey" business project.
MicroGesPage.schemaDescription1: Electricity is produced through the MHP
MicroGesPage.schemaDescription2: Produced and purchased by "Regional Electric Networks" JSC
MicroGesPage.docsDescription: Our MHP activities are based on the official policy and support of the Government of the Republic of Uzbekistan, as outlined in Decree No. 129, dated March 28th, 2025. This decree provides for measures to increase the capacity of businesses to generate electricity through the use of water resources, thereby improving the sustainability of the electricity supply to various sectors of the economy and the general population. The goal is to ensure energy security for the entire economy and promote sustainable development.
MicroGesPage.projectsDescription: Currently, "Yashil Energya" LLC is implementing the MHP-1 project on the Margunenkov Canal in the Okrugan district of the Tashkent region. The station has a capacity of 270 kW and is designed to efficiently utilize local water resources to generate electricity for nearby areas.
MicroGesPage.futuresDescription: Our company plans to launch five new MHP projects in 2025. These projects will be implemented in different regions of Uzbekistan, and will help improve the stable supply of electricity for thousands of residents.

ChargingStationPage.needsTitle: The need for an electricity charging station in Uzbekistan:

need1.title: Environmental protection
need1.description: The use of electric vehicles (EVs) will increase through charging stations, which helps reduce the amount of the air harmful gases, including carbon dioxide. This will reduce environmental pollution, contribute to the preservation of a healthy lifestyle.

need2.title: More efficient energy use
need2.description: EVs do not rely on traditional fuels, which means they help to save natural resources in Uzbekistan. The country has a high need to diversify its energy sources, and supporting electric vehicles can help achieve this goal.

need3.title: Reduce transportation costs
need3.description: The use of EVs is cheaper than vehicles moving on traditional fuel. This will help reduce transport costs for the population.

ChargingStationPage.benefitsTitle: The benefits of an EV charging station:

benefit1.title: Sustainable energy supply
benefit1.description: Recharge stations, especially when connected to renewable energy sources, ensure the duration and stability of energy supply.

benefit2.title: Opportunities for economic growth
benefit2.description: With the development of electric charging infrastructure, new jobs will be created and new business opportunities will open up for private investors. This will contribute to economic growth and the adoption of new technologies.

benefit3.title: Convenience for EV owners
benefit3.description: Charging stations will be useful for managing electricity over long distances if they are installed in strategic locations along roads. This would support domestic tourism and economic activity.

benefit4.title: Digital integration opportunity
benefit4.description: Modern charge stations can be managed and monitored through mobile applications. This allows users to find close charging stations, monitor charging time, and power.

statistic1.title: Current status
statistic1.description: As of 2025, there are several EV charging stations operating in Uzbekistan. These stations are mainly located around the capital city of Tashkent and other major cities.

statistic2.title: Plans
statistic2.description: The Uzbek government plans to expand electricity recharges in the next 5 years and establish additional charges stations on large highways.

statistic3.title: Growth forecast
statistic3.description: According to the data, the share of electricity in the Uzbek car market is expected to increase significantly until 2030, which increases the demand for charging stations.
